name: quebracho
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ] a South American tree, known for its hard wood and for producing tannin (= a chemical used as a dye and in the production of leather): They said that the best woods for burning were the hard ones, like the wood of the quebracho tree. The red quebrachos are the dominant species in this region.
[ U ] the hard wood of the quebracho tree: The sculpture is made of marble and quebracho, a very hard Argentine wood. The railway was built to haul quebracho logs.
[ C or U ] a substance produced from the quebracho tree, containing tannin (= a chemical): The animals in the treatment group received hay that was supplemented with quebracho, which is rich in condensed tannins. These quebrachos (crude tannin extracts) are the most effective so far tested.
More examplesFewer examplesThe study investigated the effects of quebracho tannin on intestinal parasites in rats.
